resources.string: AsteroidTracker is developed by BunnyFish, a San Francisco app team.

AsteroidTracker is an astronomy app providing the latest information on  Near-Earth Objects. By NASA\'s definition, Near-Earth Objects (NEOs) are "comets and asteroids that have been nudged by the gravitational attraction of nearby planets into orbits that allow them to enter the Earth\'s neighborhood."

Basically, they\'re the space stuff flying by our planet at relatively close ranges.

The AsteroidTracker app provides information on NEOs that are making their closest pass to Earth soon, those that just passed  and the relative distances at which they\'re by whizzing by. We\'ve recently added the SpaceTracks  tab to provide you with the latest and greatest in   space-related news, culture, fun and photos.

AsteroidTracker and SpaceTracks are labors of love, provided freely by a couple of nerds who want more people to care about astronomy, space travel and science in general. We love to hear from our users with suggestions, (respectful) complaints, questions or anything else you want to tell us.

Thanks for checking us out, and long live science!

Sincerely,
The Nerds at BunnyFish

"Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge."   Carl Sagan

Email the BunnyFish team: BunnyFishApps@gmail.com
Check out all of the SpaceTracks posts, new and old, on Tumblr! - http://spacetracks.tumblr.com
